alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:44AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY... An atmospheric river is affecting the northern half of Southeast Alaska. As of 8 AM Saturday, Yakutat and Juneau have measured 1-2 inches of rain, while Sitka and Pelican measured 2-3 inches. A wave in the front will cause a resurgence of rainfall rates Saturday afternoon with an additional 0.5-1.5 inches expected. The heavy rain produced fast rises on small and flashy streams but most have remained near or below bankful. Another rise will occur Saturday afternoon and evening with the resurgence, but all should trend down as rainfall rates decrease starting late Saturday night.
